page.title: 06New Forest-Deer Research
page.content: {Fallow}and{Roe}deer are found throughout these inclosures. The Japanese race of{Sika}deer is found to the south of the railway line which effectively cuts this area into two sections. The Fallow and Roe deer do cross from one side to the other to the west towards Brockenhurst. One {Muntjac,}a Chinese Reeves deer was sighted in 1981. Apart from the effect of the railway line, the deer are not restricted in their movements, but being woodland creatures they tend to keep to the forest and only venture out into the open in search of extra food in the middle of winter.{The deer live off {the forest}and are only fed by man under harsh conditions. Outside the breeding season in October females can be seen in small family groups and males in larger groups of 20 to 30.
